results.title: Charlie's day
results.creator_credit: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A warning, though in comic style, that pure oxygen is a hazard, and a serious one, when handled without care in hospitals and elsewhere. Charlie, a hospital orderly, creates havoc just in moving a cylinder from storeroom to bedside. The film demonstrates how oxygen makes substances more combustible, even so unlikely a material as steel wool. A film for staff training wherever oxygen is used.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Martin Defalco, George Pearson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Channel country
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The West Queensland cattle country. This film shows the plains of South-western Queensland and the intricate network of water courses, which during the wet season flood and provide irrigation for rich natural pastures, on which large herds of cattle are fattened for marketing; but which also brings the mail, freight, news and gossip to the outlying homesteads.

results.title: The Changing wheat belt
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows the life of the wheat farmers of the West during the 1960’s and the changes their life and work are undergoing. Farms are larger but need fewer men. The drift is to the city where new industries develop, but wheat still dominates western life.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Changing of the guard = Zmiana warty
results.brief_description: An animated fairy tale in which all of the characters - the soldier of the Royal Guard, the King’s daughter whom he loves, and all the King’s subjects are matchboxes which go up in flames because they have not learned the dangers of playing with fire.

results.title: Change in the Western Mountains
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Shows how the formidable forest covered mountains of British Columbia have been transformed over time. Engineers have built around and through the mountains; abundant mineral resources have been utilised; arid areas irrigated; and the port of Vancouver rapidly expanded. But there still remains a beautiful wilderness of mountain scenery. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: Champions in the sun
results.creator_credit: Riddell Black, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studios
results.brief_description: Describes the Royal Highland Show at Ingliston near Edinburgh. Cattle and sheep are judged by experts, and sequences describe the background of some of the pedigree animals, explaining the features which are expected in stock of this quality. Also includes show, crafts and bands. Narrated by Douglas Murchie.

results.title: The Chameleon
results.creator_credit: Boulton-Hawker Films and Films of Africa
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the chameleon, film in its natural habitat in Rhodesia. General and close-up shots illustrate the animal’s appearance and movements, details of feet and eye movements, colour changes of the skin in response to light and temperament. Normal and slow-motion photography shows the action of the tongue in catching insect food. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Challenge in the desert
results.creator_credit: United Nations. Dept. of Public Information
results.brief_description: After assisting Libya to gain independence in 1951, the United Nations has continued to give technical assistance to develop the country. As much of the land is unsuitable for cultivation, future prosperity depends on improving crops. Cooperatives for the citrus fruit and sheep industries have been formed and reforestation and irrigation projects are under way.

results.title: Centennial Park
results.creator_credit: Susan Doring, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A look at Centennial Park in Sydney - its beauty and history, its importance to wildlife and the use people make of it. Photographer: Ross King. Narrated by Tim Eliott.

results.title: Caverns and geysers
results.brief_description: Illustrates how underground water is constantly changing our earth. We see the results of its action in limestone regions where underground water has dissolved out large caverns. In a few areas we see spectacular hot springs and geysers, created when volcanic rock heats water under the ground. Filmed with the co-operation of Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Sequoia National Park and Yellowstone National Park.
